title: What is your favorite Spotify playlist ? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hey Harsh, thanks for requesting! Currently, my favorite Spotify playlist is the one they compose for people at the end of the year. Many of my favorite songs and covers are on this playlist. Lots of feel good songs that get me in an amazing mood. It’s one of the great things about Spotify, among all of them. It’s personalized to each person, which means no playlist is the same. To me, it shows me an overview of my year. As far as I can see, it goes in chronological order, from the start of the year, until late November/early December. It shows all of my moods throughout the year. It’s like a musical diary. However, I realize that this playlist is only available at the end of the year, in the month of December, unless you save it to listen to later on. So. One of my favorite playlists on Spotify is the main playlist that I made. It consists of 3,533 songs currently. I listen to the playlist daily. Some of my favorite playlists that are made by Spotify aren’t technically aren`t music, but rather sounds of rains and nature and such. Other of my favorite playlists that are made by Spotify that include actual music are mainly classical playlists, jazz playlists, instrumental playlists, country and rock and rock n` roll radios, etc.,. I listen to a mix of everything, but these are just some of my favorites.

I really enjoy 20th century pop music from jazz/blues to Rock n’Roll, Soul,Motown, Punk Post Punk, 80’s Indie,Synth, Outsider and alternative. I also like percussion,some world music and instrumental, surf… and country too…but I’m still stuck in the 20th century mostly..I’ll get to the 21st pretty soon though! *** I listen to all these playlists on shuffle so I can get lots of variety gym, a playlist by Corey James Wiley on Spotify Surf Age Nuggets +, a playlist by Corey James Wiley on Spotify https://open.spotify.com/user/1229164294/playlist/15Dm4LKcJjDN1TEuOq5suz?si=oe_AsnaTQIuFweD5F5KAYw https://open.spotify.com/user/1229164294/playlist/6zAk5UMtRfxc3e29GRZhpO?si=RGhg3mYqQkayQOZLzjcIKA https://open.spotify.com/user/1229164294/playlist/794NsZZ8oFCR0nf1lmtLlT?si=lZyR-GlvQgu3urBXFGALzg https://open.spotify.com/user/1229164294/playlist/7dNhd3JyvpNvBThHOtK58M?si=QJj_nhlsQEytci3OAGOlZA https://open.spotify.com/user/1229164294/playlist/1nqhvet5XRYug2W5IWrCOK?si=lqEE7si6Tpm2n4_kW_nNug Rolling Stones Meet The Beatles/Kinks/Zombies/Barrett, a playlist by Corey James Wiley on Spotify Surf/Stax/Trad Jazz/Motown/Beatles, a playlist by Corey James Wiley on Spotify

If you’re talking about the ones I’ve made on Spotify then probably this one titled ‘classic bih’ that just has songs that I found from other playlists that I like. But if you’re talking about playlist that Spotify themselves have made then probably the ‘this is….’ playlist b/c those help me whenever I heard someone say ‘oh x is my favorite band’. Or if I hear a song by a band I’ve never heard before & wanna listen to more of their stuff. The only bad side of them is that they only include the most listened/most popular songs and if they have 2 versions of the same song (like 5sos’ Easier & then their other version w/ Charlie Puth), they tend to play them right after another.

My favourite Spotify playlist is probably my own, if I’m going to be honest. It’s the only playlist I’ve seen that caters towards my own personal musical taste and has most of the songs I like on it. I do occasionally listen to other playlists, but I just like to listen to what I like. My playlist is titled “The Better Emo Playlist” - The Better Emo Playlist, a playlist by rappisch on Spotify It has songs from Starset, Downplay, Slipknot, Thrice, Zardonic, Solence, Theory of a Dead Man and much more. I’d recommend if you like alternate rock, cinematic rock, heavy metal and even some electro.
My favorite playlists:Songs About Bad

That’d have to be one of my own. Not to toot my own horn. And I don’t necessarily have a favorite one. Some frequent listens by me: Favorites, a playlist by almightylord565 on Spotify (Just my saved songs put into a playlist)The Greatest of Classic Rock, a playlist by almightylord565 on SpotifyRapCaviar, a playlist by SpotifyEnter Sandman, a playlist by almightylord565

Here is my best one: ⚡️🧜‍♂️⚡️, a playlist by yoyovilleruler on Spotify I’ll be adding things in and taking things out over time, just tweaking it all a certain way, but currently, this is the best playlist I’ve ever made. Which basically means, to me, this is the best playlist I’ve ever heard. If you take the time to listen to it, let me know how you like it! Thank you.

Easy. I have a playlist for classic Rock and rockish stuff from my childhood. Another for rap. One is for metal. One is for dance/techno/anything that fits there. I have a punk playlist. Obe for Insane Clown Posse and artists that are or have been associated with Phsycopathic Records. Finally alternative and stuff that doesn't fit elsewhere.

This is several years dated but I spent the most time sifting through songs to add into it. It won’t necessarily be your best if you don’t like the genre. Feel free to see if I have any more you might want to hear. Enjoy. #1 DUBSTEPPERS~ Electrostep / Electro House / Upbeat Dubstep / Dance Mix Loverz, a playlist by Jon Waters on Spotify

Personally, here is the Best 10 Spotify Playlists We Can’t Miss: 1.	Today's Top Hits 2.	RapCaviar 3.	Are & Be 4.	Songs to Sing in the Car 5.	Get Turnt 6.	Mint 7.	Beast Mode 8.	Love Pop 9.	Happy Hits 10. The Most Beautiful Songs in the World

Some of my favorite playlists created by Spotify: Best of John Peel Sessions K-Pop Daebak Music for Concentration Night Rain Virtual Reality Some of my own playlists I’m most happy with are those where I collect essentials in genres that I enjoy, such as post-punk and shoegaze.

i might be biased, but i feel that my music taste is superior. lmao, i’m joking, but this playlist has some bops. nymphet <3, a playlist by Hal napper on Spotify A playlist about liking older guys. yup, that’s it.

All of us love listening to music. It relaxes our mind and therefore, is the best way one can get rid of the busy lifestyle and enjoy. There are several great apps in the present for this and Spotify is one of the best ones available up to date. It gives access to a very large range of music of various artists from all over the world. Read more at: Best Spotify playlists-The best way to entertain yourself! - Free Tool Tips
Hi ! here are my personal top 4 at the moment: - Underground Trap / Rap - Electronica / lofi beats - Ambient Chill - Afta Party Hope you would enjoy them!

Well apart from my own ones, it would be this one at the moment. AOR / Melodic Rock / Westcoast - The Ultimate Collection, a playlist by Rocknytt on Spotify I am catching up a lot of 80s rock that past me by and this playlist is just immense! It has current music as well but good luck telling the difference hehe

desmond and the polemics of day to day life by tehrazo desmond and the polemics of day to day life, a playlist by tehrazo on Spotify lots of rock- all good stuff. If you like the songs, you can use Sidify to download them as mp3 files to your local computer for offline listening.

You can. Assuming you mean share the contents: In Windows, Linux or Mac you can right click (or two-finger click) and share.In Android you can long press and share, or hit the three dots in the top right and shareIn iOS, you hit the three buttons in the top right and share.Assuming you mean share the access to edit: This can only be done on Desktop. If you right click (or two-finger click) and click Collaborative Playlist this will allow others to add or remove tracks, and change the order.
